intro: Aulacospermum latipennum, commonly known as the broad-leafed spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has a low-growing habit with a sprawling stem and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The species is also known for its milky sap, which can be toxic to livestock and humans.
